title: Bajrang Punia Returns Padma Shri:  Indian Wrestler Protests Against Brij Bhushan Aide's Election
content:
Olympic medalist Bajrang Punia has returned his Padma Shri award in protest against the election of Sanjay Singh, a close associate of former Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, as the new president. Punia, along with other wrestlers, had accused Brij Bhushan of sexual harassment and intimidation, leading to his removal from office.

In a heartfelt letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Punia expressed his anguish over the situation, stating that he feels "disrespected" by the lack of action against the accused and the continued influence of Brij Bhushan's allies within the federation. 

This powerful act of protest highlights the ongoing struggle for justice and accountability within Indian wrestling, with athletes feeling forced to choose between their integrity and their awards.
author: Scroll Staff
